docs.lead_paragraph: The biotech drugs used to treat multiple sclerosis produce health benefits that come at an exorbitant cost, according to a new study published on Wednesday.

headline.main: Study Examines High Drug Costs vs. Benefits for M.S. Patients

docs.abstract: A new study finds the costs of bio-tech drugs for treating multiple sclerosis about 10 times more than what would be considered cost-effective.
docs.snippet: A new study finds the costs of bio-tech drugs for treating multiple sclerosis about 10 times more than what would be considered cost-effective.

docs.lead_paragraph: A medical advisory panel suggested all health plans cover birth control under the new health care law.
docs.snippet: A medical advisory panel suggested all health plans cover birth control under the new health care law.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn is a whirlwind. He has agitated for change at General Motors, Time Warner, Yahoo and dozens of other companies over the last decade. But Mr. Icahn is as controversial as he is ubiquitous. In his latest move, the billionaire financier made an unsolicited bid to buyClorox, an offer that was promptly rejected by the board on Monday.

headline.main: Icahn's Activism Helps Lift Some Stocks, but Others Plunge

docs.abstract: Steven M Davidoff Deal Professor column says Carl C Icahn continues his controversial ways, noted by his unsolicited bid to buy Clorox, which has rekindled the long-running debate about whether investors benefit from his presence; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers are seeking federal approval for what is believed to be the first study to examine the effects of marijuana on veterans with chronic post-traumatic stress disorder.

headline.seo: Marijuana for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder May Be Studied
headline.main: Marijuana May Be Studied for Combat Disorder
headline.print_headline: Marijuana May Be Studied for Combat Disorder

docs.snippet: Researchers are seeking federal approval for what is believed to be the first study to examine the effects of marijuana on veterans with chronic post-traumatic stress disorder.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most doctors view pain as a symptom of an underlying problem -- treat the disease or the injury, and the pain goes away. But for large numbers of patients, the pain never goes away. In a sweeping review issued last month, the Institute of Medicine -- the medical branch of the National Academy of Sciences -- estimated that chronic pain afflicts 116 million Americans, far more than previously believed.

headline.main: Giving Chronic Pain a Medical Platform of Its Own

headline.main: Giving Chronic Pain a Medical Platform of Its Own
